meanings.definition: To adapt for a new use or function.
meanings.sent1: She exapted an old shoebox into a dollhouse.
meanings.sent2: The company exapted their marketing strategy to target a younger audience.
meanings.sent3: He exapted a broken umbrella as a makeshift sunshade.
meanings.sent4: The artist exapted discarded materials into beautiful sculptures.
meanings.sent5: The chef exapted leftovers into a delicious new dish.
